meanings.definition: A compound of chlorine with another element or group.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the properties of the chlorid in the laboratory.
meanings.sent2: The pool cleaner added chlorid to the water to keep it clean.
meanings.sent3: The chlorid and the other elements had a party in the test tube.
meanings.sent4: The chlorid bonded with the metal like old friends reuniting.
meanings.sent5: The bright green color of the chlorid stood out in the mixture.

meanings.definition: To treat or combine with chlorine or a chloride.
meanings.sent1: She chlorid the water before drinking it to make sure it was safe.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to chlorid the pool to kill any bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The chef chlorid the vegetables to preserve them for longer.
meanings.sent4: The gardener chlorid the soil to improve its quality.
meanings.sent5: He carefully chlorid the solution to achieve the desired result.
